p: The outer membrane of Gram-negative bacteria is made up of lipopolysaccharide. This membrane forms a hydrophobic barrier which restricts the diffusion of hydrophobic compounds through this coating (Nikaido and Vaara 1985). It is probably for this reason that the C. limae oil did not inhibit the growth of E. coli, P. aeruginosa and K. pneumoniae, which are Gram-negative bacteria.
